title: The Economic Impact Of Ebola
teaser: The World Bank estimates Ebola could drain $32.6 billion from the global economy if it spreads beyond Liberia, Guinea and Sierra Leone.
contentencoded:
The World Bank estimates Ebola could drain $32.6 billion from the global economy by the end of 2015 if “the epidemic spreads into neighboring countries” beyond Liberia, Guinea and Sierra Leone.

Here & Now’s Sacha Pfeiffer takes a look at the economic impact of Ebola with Mike Regan of Bloomberg News.

Guest

  • Mike Regan, editor for Bloomberg News. He tweets @Reganonymous.
